title: Quiz 4: Mental Status Assessment & History
topicName: Unit 1: Mental Health and Psychiatric Nursing
description: Evaluate your skills in patient history taking and Mental Status Assessment (MSA).

questions.question: Which of the following are components of the 'Personal History' in history taking? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Marital status is 'Personal Data'. Personal History covers development, school, and trauma.

questions.question: Match the specific history section to the information it gathers:
questions.hint: Match the name to the content.

questions.question: In a Mental Status Assessment, checking for 'Grandiosity' or 'Persecution' assesses which area?
questions.explanation: Delusions like grandiosity belong to Thought Content.

questions.question: Checking perceptual disorder involves assessing senses like ___BLANK___ (hearing voices) and ___BLANK___ (seeing things).
questions.hint: Technical terms for hearing and sight.

questions.question: In an outpatient clinic, the 'History of Presenting Illness' is best taken last.
questions.explanation: It is best taken FIRST because the patient/informant wants to talk about the immediate problem.
questions.hint: What is most urgent to the patient?

questions.question: Order the types of memory assessed from shortest to longest duration:
What term refers to the patient's awareness of their own mental illness?
questions.explanation: Insight is the awareness of one's condition.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of the physical examination in a psychiatric assessment?
questions.explanation: Financial status is social history, not physical exam.

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of perceptual disorders? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Grandiosity is a thought disorder. The others are sensory perceptions.

questions.question: When taking 'Personal Data', what specific demographic information is collected besides age and sex?
questions.explanation: Marital status, occupation, residence, and nationality are key personal data points.
questions.hint: Think of what's on an ID card.
